Html:
Hi 

 

http://greatmaps.codeplex.com/Thread/View.aspx?ThreadId=228619

 

This is the windows mobile project , it working flawless in windows ce too, but i cant able design a mobile screen. its triggering error while moving to design page.

 

 

then is that possible to enable audio for gps setting ? i mean while setting source & destination it should tel us the path.[left and right and ]

 

and is that possible to work without online with the help of cache? [to see the map]

 

please let me know..its urgent requirment for me?  Please ?

• you can disable design error by building GMap.NET.WindowsMobile with compilation symbol DESIGN, any other ideas? P.s. don't forget to remove it after you end design
  • yes, you can use cache to work off-line, basically you can copy your cache from desktop app to your sd card
  • mobile can play sounds, so maybe it's possible ;}

could you guide me regarding that cache process. because thats the process i need to do. i need to save those cache in some disk..

 

 

any articles? where i can find that cache?

C:\Users\user\AppData\Local\GMap.NET\TileDBv3\en

Both demos has integrated prefetcher, select area, click prefetch, wait ;}

hi am using server 2008 Os.here am a administrator. i cannot find the path which u posted here Sir.

 

so please give me a suggestion to find out the path of the cache file ..

 

r how can i change the file path of cache .. i have screwed alot . but i cannot do so..

 

please provide me a solution?
C:\Users\Administrator\AppData\Local\GMap.NET\TileDBv3\en\

actually am deploying into windows CE device .. i mean in another computer..

 

thats the problem.. because there is no such kind of folder located in administrator App_Data

 

whats the solution for this?
Administrator == user name, i don't know your user names ;}

ya i have found out buddy :)

 

if i need to change the path of cache location in the sense.. where i need to change the code ?

 

please give some suggestion Sir.
map.CacheLocation = "C:\GMapCache\";

Hi

 

i cannot find this path in windows mobile ..

where that code ll be?

 

could you give me a file name?

on mobile its your SD card:

string sd = Native.GetRemovableStorageDirectory();
if(!string.IsNullOrEmpty(sd))
{
   CacheLocation = sd + Path.DirectorySeparatorChar + "GMap.NET" + Path.DirectorySeparatorChar;
 }

Hi!

In windows mobile , where we specify the path to save the cache file, could you give me the filename in that project ?

 

please, its urgent ?

i have trouble while running windows mobile , i cannot create cache file in local,

 

but while running windows form its automatcally creating the cache file.

 

where the error will be?
the same in mobile, it's created automatically

actually i cannot load the map in emulator Sir.

but while deploying in windows CE device its working perfectly,

my doubt , if sdk emulator works , it might create cache file.? is it so?

it should, maybe your emulator just don't have internet connection? Try browse google.com

cache in emulator: System.Environment.GetFolderPath(System.Environment.SpecialFolder.ApplicationData) + Path.DirectorySeparatorChar + "GMap.NET" + Path.DirectorySeparatorChar;

Please,

 

could you give me the file name, for changing the file path to save cache file?

 

please ?

radioman!

 

got it.

i found the folder which is creating in ce device.

 

but mobile cache file is not creating .

what problem it might be?
by default cache should be in "\\Application Data\\GMap.NET\\"

nope!

 

its creating folders perfectly,

i mean Application Data\GMap.NET\TileDBv3\en\?

 

in CE device this path is creating automatically while running mobile project? but there is no file like Data.gmdb Sir.

 

please sort  out my issue?
if db is failed to create you should see exception message("CreateEmptyDB: .....") in debug output window
anyway, you can try copy there your prepared database, from C:\Users\user\AppData\Local\GMap.NET\TileDBv3\en in windows
